intro: Amarella microcalyx, commonly known as the dwarf amarella, is a species of flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in gardens and small-scale farms.
